title: How to Access Your SD Card on Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Swipe down on the notification bar.
steps.content: Swipe down on the notification bar.

steps.title: Tap on the Settings icon.
steps.content: Tap on the Settings icon. It’s the gear at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap on Application manager.
steps.content: Tap on Application manager . It’s located towards the middle of the page.

steps.title: Swipe left.
steps.content: Swipe left. Doing so will bring you to a list of apps stored on your SD card where you can manage them from there.

steps.title: Tap the app you want to manage.
steps.content: Tap the app you want to manage.

steps.title: Tap on Move to SD card.
steps.content: Tap on Move to SD card . Doing so will transfer the app to external storage. You will need a microSD card inserted in your device for this to work.

steps.title: Tap on Move to Device Storage.
steps.content: Tap on Move to Device Storage . This will move the app back to your internal storage.

steps.title: Tap Uninstall.
steps.content: Tap Uninstall . Doing so will completely remove the app from your device and you’ll have managed your applications by accessing the SD card.
